content:
Thunderbird is a FREE, opensource program. No donation is required to download, install, or use it, though it is appreciated by the developers.

Be sure you are downloading it from the official source, not some scam cite.

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/
creator: rednoise

content:
Hi Meg,

People sometimes report that the download did not happen, but they are just not looking in the right place. Have you looked where your browser is set to save downloaded files?

Of course, there will be a message about downloading each time a person downloads. The download site doesn't know what you have done in the past.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Hi Steve,

Would you please describe a specific example of a move? What file? From where? To where? (What are you calling "main"?) Exactly what steps do you take? What makes you think that files get corrupted? What formatting is convoluted in local folders but straightforward in "main"?

"Moves some, sometimes, then won't move, or will move some but not all," — Some files and folders get moved in the file system but others don't? You copy and paste them or you click and drag them, and some move but some don't?

Some context for these operations would be helpful too. Why are you moving files and folders from local folders to "main"? Is your e-mail account an IMAP or a POP account? Why do you move files and folders in the file system instead of moving folders and messages in Thunderbird?

With more information, someone may be able to help.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Try TB Menu Bar > View > Layout > Classic View.

(Most don't see the top menu bar (https://i.imgur.com/OTvCzJ6.png), as it's hidden by default. If you don't see it, press the ALT key. To make the menu bar always visible, press ALT + V, then T, then M.)

content:
The link states "Panacea.dat was replaced with folderCache.json. Close TB, rename folderCache.json, and restart TB."

So here's my additional question. With macOS it's easy enough to create either an applescript or an automator app to just delete the file. Would that be an acceptable solution as well?
creator: Homer712

content: Yes, as long as TB is closed when the script is run. The json file is recreated automatically on TB restart.

content:
Wilt u berichten met een bepaalde inhoud blokkeren of e-mailadressen? Dit kunt u met filters inregelen.

Mogelijk relevante hulpartikelen:

  • Een afzender blokkeren
  • Uw berichten ordenen door filters te gebruiken
  • Thunderbird en ongewenste of spamberichten

Als u de berichten helemaal niet in Thunderbird wilt ontvangen, zult u iets dergelijks moeten doen op de e-mailserver van uw provider, dus via webmail.

è molto improbabile che la compattazione perda delle mail, più spesso si tratta di email sincronizzate tramite IMAP e poi rimosse dal server di cui su Thunderbird restano solo le intestazioni.

Ricordo comunque che come per qualsiasi programma anche per Thunderbird da questi rischi ci si tutela con una backup periodico -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

Ricordo anche che una apposita funzione di Thunderbird permette di tentare la riparazione delle cartelle danneggiate -> https://codeberg.org/m13o/TBook/wiki/Thunderbird+-+Catena+di+manutenzione.-

creator: jjanderson52000

content: Sometimes thunderbird creates a new profile on updates. So, my guess is that it is there somewhere. Try this: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' - if more that one profile is listed, your addressbook may be there. - click 'open folder' on the suspect profile - look for a file named 'abook.sqlite' and see if it appears to have been recently updated. Note its location on disk - in thunderbird, click tools>import>import from a file - follow the addressbook links to the screen with 'sqlite' as an option. click there and then select the 'abook.sqlite file you found - repeat the step to import the related 'history.sqlite' file

content: It's never been an issue and I agree it should not be possible. I use a number of email addresses depending on whether business, personal or other. I fill in the correct from address if it is wrong. After I send it the email shows in the wrong send folder and Thunderbird has changed the from to a different email. A search shows this can be fixed by setting the default. That no longer works, I can't change it. I have started using Gmail, which I hate but it works as expected. This has worked correctly for many years but this problem has cropped up due to a recent patch. It has caused some explaining since people who should not have the company email now have it. Embarrassing.
creator: russ.nes

content:
So Thunderbird changes a customized from address, and you and your recipients see a from address that is different from what you typed. Is that right? That could give a person the impression that Thunderbird was changing data after sending a message.

I'm not familiar with the use of customized from addresses. I use aliases and identitities, which seems to me to be a better for sending from a different address on the same account. Have you considered using them? You would not have to keep typing the same from addresses.

I have not been able to learn much about customized from addresses. Let's hope that other people know more.

What version of Thunderbird are you using?
creator: mozilla98

content:
If a non-gmail account is set to send on a gmail smtp, the From of the non-gmail account is automatically switched to the gmail address, so the recipient sees the message as having been sent from the gmail account. The remedy is to set the non-gmail account to send on the smtp with non-gmail settings, i.e. the smtp User Name is the non-gmail address.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1438310
creator: sfhowes

content: Add the account as IMAP to download all folders. POP accounts only download the Inbox.
creator: sfhowes

content: First, thunderbird does not disallow POP. if you upgraded, your POP account was not dismissed; more likely, thunderbird created a new profile. Your old profile is still there and can be reactivated. If you want to continue as IMAP, let us know and maybe someone here will assist in the transition. On the other hand, you can reactivate your POP account instead. Let us know. thank you
